info.author: Matthew Wardrop
info.description:
`transformpy` is a Python 2/3 module for doing transforms on "streams" of data.
The transforms can be applied to any python iterable object, and so can be used
for continuous real_time streams or static streams (such as from a file). It
is designed in such a manner that it uses very little memory (unless necessary
by clustering and/or aggregation routines). It was originally designed to
allow python transformations (maps and reductions) of data stored within HIVE,
using the Hadoop streaming paradigm.

**NOTE:** TransformPy is *not* guaranteed to be API stable before version 1.0;
but changes should be small if any to the current version.
info.name: transformpy
info.summary: A general purpose python ETL/pipeline utility library, for use especially with Hive Streaming.
info.html_description:
transformpy is a Python 2/3 module for doing transforms on “streams” of data. The transforms can be applied to any python iterable object, and so can be used for continuous real_time streams or static streams (such as from a file). It is designed in such a manner that it uses very little memory (unless necessary by clustering and/or aggregation routines). It was originally designed to allow python transformations (maps and reductions) of data stored within HIVE, using the Hadoop streaming paradigm.

NOTE: TransformPy is not guaranteed to be API stable before version 1.0; but changes should be small if any to the current version.
